vada: <entryFree id="n50073" type="main" key="Va^da2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Văda</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n50073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Liguria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Savona</hi>, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 10, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called Vada Sabatia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 7, § 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50074" type="main" key="Va^da3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Văda Volaterrana</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n50074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a port in Etruria south of Pisa</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Torre di Vado</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vadimonis: <entryFree id="n50075" type="main" key="Va^di^mo_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vădĭmōnis lăcus</orth>, <sense id="n50075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small lake in Etruria near Ameria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Laghetto di Bassano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 95, 96, § 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 39, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 20, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:25:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 25, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the order lacus Vadimonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:13:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 13, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. Dennis, Etruria, 1, p. 107 sq.</sense></entryFree>
vadimonium: <entryFree id="n50076" type="main" key="va^di^mo_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vădĭmōnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. vas</etym>; jurid. t. t., <sense id="n50076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promise secured by bail</hi> for appearance on a particular day before a tribunal, <hi rend="ital">bail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">security</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recognizance.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50076.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: cum autem in jus vocatus fuerit adversarius ni eo die finitum fuerit negotium, vadimonium ei faciendum est, id est, ut promittat, se certo <cb n="VADO" /> die sisti, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 184</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">as to the sev. eral kinds of vadimonia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 185</bibl></cit> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi tu's, qui me convadatu's Veneriis vadimoniis?</quote> <trans><tr>to appear before Venus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se jam neque vadari amplius neque vadimonium promittere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 23</bibl></cit>: hominem in praesentia non vadatur; <cit><quote lang="la">ita sine vadimonio disceditur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis extra suum forum vadimonium promittere cogatur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:15:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 15, § 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 20, 63</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">promittere (alicui Romam Lilybaeum, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:54:section=141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 54, § 141</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tull. 8, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">constituere,</quote> <trans><tr>to fix by agreement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concipere,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw up a form of recognizance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aptius hae capiant vadimonia garrula cerae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:12:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 12, 23</bibl></cit>: res esse in vadimonium coepit, <hi rend="ital">comes to giving bail</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">is to be tried by due course of law</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 5, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vadimonium est mihi cum aliquo,</quote> <trans><tr>am under recognizance</tr>, <tr>am bound to appear</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 56</bibl></cit>: sistere, <hi rend="ital">to keep one's recognizance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make one's appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">present one's self in court</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:14:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 8, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 9, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. sisto, I. C. 2.: ad vadimonium venire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 21, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non venire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 48</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">16, 52 sq.: quā (horā) tibi vadimonium non sit obitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 53</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">obire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">descendere ad vadimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 8:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occurrere ad vadimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad vadimonium currere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 2, 57: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 18, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 32, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:298" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 298</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">differre,</quote> <trans><tr>to put off the day of appearance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteris quae habebat vadimonia differt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 6, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imponere alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to exact</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deserere,</quote> <trans><tr>to forfeit one's recognizance</tr>, <tr>fail to appear</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 23, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 2, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Plin. prooem. § 23: missum facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to release one's bail</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 14, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. on the vadimonium, Dict. of Antiq. s. v.—</sense><sense id="n50076.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an appointment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fixed time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eventu significationum intellegi sidera debebunt, non ad dies utique praefinitos exspectari tempestatum vadimonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 62, § 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi amatorem vadimonio sistam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 227, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10</bibl>, p. 240, 10 al.</sense></entryFree>
vado: <entryFree id="n50077" type="main" key="va_do1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vādo</orth> (vāsi, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>cf. Sanscr. root gā-, go; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*b*a, ai/nw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n50077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">walk;</hi> esp. <hi rend="ital">to go hastily</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rapidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rush</hi> (syn. incedo). </sense><sense id="n50077.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.): vadunt solidā vi, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 10</bibl> (Ann. v. 277 Vahl.): ingenti cursu, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=363" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 363</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 470 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum feras bestias videamus alacres et erectas vadere, ut alteri bestiae noceant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 19, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vadit fremit refringit virgulta pede vago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vadimus inmixti Danais,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2</bibl></cit> 396: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eum (Pompeium) postridie mane vadebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad amnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde in primum aditum pontis, Liv 2, 10, 5: in hostem,</quote> <trans><tr>to stride on</tr>, <tr>advance</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 24, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud dubi am in mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 359</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cras mane vadit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vadite, et haec memores regi mandata referte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 176</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 223</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50077.2" n="B" level="2"> Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">Euphrates in Mesopotamiam vadit per ipsam Seleuciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 26, 21, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circulus per medios Parthos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 34, 39, § 213</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50077.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardua per praeceps gloria vadit iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:3:74" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vadit animus in praeceps sciens, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 180" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eruditi et rude vulgus in eam (sententiam) cursu vadit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 117, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50078" type="main" key="va^do2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vădo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vadum</etym>, <sense id="n50078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wade through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ford</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina, quae sine pontibus vadari nequeunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia neque navium copia pro tempore erat, neque vadari fluvius poterat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 1, 22, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vador: <entryFree id="n50079" type="main" key="va^dor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vădor</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype> (<sense id="n50079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> vadarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 40</bibl>), 1, <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [1. vas]; jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to bind over by bail</hi> to appear in court: <hi rend="ital">Sa.</hi> Vadatur hic me. <hi rend="ital">Poe.</hi> Utinam vades desint, in carcere ut sis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulat, ut sibi liceret milvom vadarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque vadari amplius neque vadimonium promittere ... hominem vadari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Apronius) cum ex Leontino usque ad Lilybaeum aliquem vadaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:15:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 15, § 38</bibl></cit>: tot vadibus accusator vadatus <pb n="1952" /> <cb n="VAE" /> est reum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 13, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque vadaturus, lecticā prodeat, inquit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 665</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casu tunc respondere vadato Debebat (= ei, qui eum vadatus erat, vadimonio obligaverat),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 36</bibl></cit>.!*? <orth extent="full" lang="la">vădātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif. (prop. <hi rend="ital">bound over</hi> to appear in court; hence, transf., in gen.), <hi rend="ital">bound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pledged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engaged</hi> to do any thing (ante- and postclass.): vadatus = obstrictus vel sub fidejussione ambulans; <cit><quote lang="la">sicut Fenestella ait: apud quem vadatus amicitiae nodulo tenebatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Expos. Serm. Ant. p. 567</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita me vadatum amore vinctumque attines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: trico, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 8, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">memineris mihi reliqua vitae tuae curricula vadata,</quote> <trans><tr>devoted</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 259, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:Pan. Theod. 17" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> Pan. Theod. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vadosus: <entryFree id="n50080" type="main" key="va^do_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vădōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vadum</etym>, <sense id="n50080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of shallows</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fords</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shallow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shoal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:728" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 728</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syrtes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 78:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 78, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostium portūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>, ext. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">navigatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 99</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>restless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:698" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 698</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ganges ubi vadosissimus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vadum: <entryFree id="n50081" type="main" key="va^dum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vădum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n50081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> collat form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">vă-dus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 68</bibl> Dietsch) [cf. the root BA, <foreign lang="greek">bai/nw</foreign>, whence, also, vado; hence, that through which one can go], <hi rend="ital">a shallow place in water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a shallow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shoal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ford.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50081.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50081.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodanus nonnullis locis vado transitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vadum in flumine efficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vadum fluminis temptare, si transire possent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum vado transducere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vado flumen penetrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vado superari amnis non poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 13, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 18, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscis qui vivit in vado,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis incerto vado,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50081.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Piur.</hi>, so esp. of a shallow place where a river is crossed, <hi rend="ital">a ford</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi vadis repertis partem suarum copiarum transducere conati sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 45, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 200</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 370</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 19</bibl>.—Also of <hi rend="ital">shallows</hi>, as dangerous in navigation: mystica ad dextram vada Praetervecti, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, 19</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. v. 687 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">brevia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dura saxis Lilybeia caecis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 706</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Nessus, scitus vadorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 108</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50081.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50081.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A body of water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stream</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">longā sulcant vada salsa carinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 158</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tamen Non tangenda rates transiliunt vada,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:9:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 181 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 181 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50081.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The bottom</hi> of a body of water, <hi rend="ital">the depths</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">saxa Vadis levata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:26" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3</bibl>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">4: ostrea capta solido vado,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 6, 21, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedit limoso pressa carina vado,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:300" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 300</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50081.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The bottom</hi> of a well, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 23, § 39</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n50081.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50081.9" n="A" level="2"> Of shallow water, as a place of safety to the swimmer: <cit><quote lang="la">haec propemodum jam esse in vado salutis res videtur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in safety</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at in vado'st: jam facile enabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis res est jam in vado,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50081.10" n="B" level="2"> Of shallows, as dangerous to the mariner: <cit><quote lang="la">emersisse jam e vadis et scopulos praetervecta videtur oratio mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:21:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 21, 51</bibl></cit>: cera vadum tentet, rasis infusa tabellis, <hi rend="ital">explore the way</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">make a first attempt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 437</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vadus: <entryFree id="n50082" type="main" key="va^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vădus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. vadum <sense id="n50082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vae: <entryFree id="n50083" type="main" key="vae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vae</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ou)ai/</foreign></etym>, an exclamation of pain or dread, <sense id="n50083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ah! alas!</hi> </sense><sense id="n50083.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mantua, vae, miserae nimium vicina Cremonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 13, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vae verbero!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50083.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Very freq. like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ou)ai/</foreign> and our <hi rend="ital">woe!</hi> with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vae misero mihi!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergo meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capiti atque aetati tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 44</bibl></cit>.—Esp., in the exclamation ascribed to Brennus: <cit><quote lang="la">vae victis! intoleranda Romanis vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:48:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 48, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:13:17" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 13, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=372" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 372</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 19</bibl>; also, as title of a Satire by Varro, v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 82, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">156, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">492, 8</bibl> (Müll. de victis).— </sense><sense id="n50083.3" n="(g)" level="5"> Very rarely with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vae te!</quote> <trans><tr>woe to you!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelesta, vae te!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vae me!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apocol. 4:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apocol. 4, 3</bibl></cit>. <cb n="VAGI" /></sense></entryFree>
vaecors: <entryFree id="n50084" type="main" key="vaecors"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vaecors</orth>, v. vecors.</entryFree>
vaeneo: <entryFree id="n50085" type="main" key="vaene^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vaenĕo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">vaenum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. veneo and venum.</entryFree>
vafellus: <entryFree id="n50086" type="gloss" key="va^fellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văfellus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n50086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi>, from vafer, acc. to Fest. s. v. altellus, p. 7 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
vafer: <entryFree id="n50087" type="main" key="va^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văfer</orth>, <itype>fra, frum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n50087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crafty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subtle</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: callidus, versutus): (hominis) non aperti, non simplicis, non ingenui, non justi, non viri boni, versuti potius, obscuri, astuti, fallacis, malitiosi, callidi, veteratoris, vafri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:13:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 13, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in disputando vafri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:16:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 16, 26</bibl></cit> (cited ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 19, 33</bibl>); Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 20, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 130</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 7, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 30</bibl>: lingua, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 19, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Flaccus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:116" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 116</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:132" default="NO">1, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:61:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 61, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores Hannibalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>, ext. 8: <cit><quote lang="la">vafra et fallaciosa argumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:34" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 34</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 38, 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoicorum somniorum vaferrimus interpres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:15:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interrogationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 48:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 48, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vā^frē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">slyly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cunningly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artfully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil sane vafre nec malitiose facere conatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:53:section=132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 53, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam vafre Telluri impressum osculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>, ext. 2.</sense></entryFree>
vaframentum: <entryFree id="n50088" type="main" key="va_^fra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vā^frāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vafer</etym>, <sense id="n50088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a crafly device</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quirk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artifice</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 3</bibl>, ext. 7; so<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3</bibl>, ext. 2; 7, 3, ext. 4.</sense></entryFree>
vafre: <entryFree id="n50089" type="main" key="va_^fre_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vā^frē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vafer <sense id="n50089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vafritia: <entryFree id="n50090" type="hapax" key="va_^fri^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vā^frĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vafer</etym>, <sense id="n50090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">craftiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artfulness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vafritiam meam experiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 49:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 49, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 3</bibl> prooem.</sense></entryFree>
vaga: <entryFree id="n50091" type="main" key="Va^ga^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Văgă</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vagenses</orth>, v. 2. Vacca.</entryFree>
vagabundus: <entryFree id="n50092" type="main" key="va^ga_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văgābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vagor</etym>, <sense id="n50092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">strolling about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vagabond</hi> (ante- and postclass.), Fenest. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per annos ferme novem, quibus eos vagabundus audivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 5:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:13:5" default="NO">13, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5, 24</bibl></cit>; Dracont. Hexaëm. 1, 257.</sense></entryFree>
vagatio: <entryFree id="n50093" type="main" key="va^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a strolling about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wandering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roaming</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incerta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 50, 15</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam in certas facies inter vitam ac mortem coloris est vagatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:18:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 18, 1</bibl></cit> Haase.</sense></entryFree>
vagatus: <entryFree id="n50094" type="main" key="va^ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văgātus</orth>, <itype>us</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, = vagatio (late Lat.), Jul. ap. Aug. c. Sec. Resp. Jul. 4, 38.</entryFree>
vage: <entryFree id="n50095" type="main" key="va^ge_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văgē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vagus <sense id="n50095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vagia: <entryFree id="n50096" type="main" key="Vagi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vagĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Vacĕa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Lusitania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Vonga</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Conga</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 21, 35, § 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vagienni: <entryFree id="n50097" type="main" key="Vagienni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vagienni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-genni</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Alpine people of Liguria</hi>, whose chief town was Augusta Vagiennorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 7</bibl>, §§ 47 and 49; 3, 16, 20, § 117; 3, 20, 24, § 135; called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bagenni</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:607" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 607</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vagina: <entryFree id="n50098" type="main" key="va_gi_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vāgīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. vas</etym>, <sense id="n50098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scabbard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sheath.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50098.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of a sword, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:7:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 7, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:579" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 579</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 260</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 475</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 475</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:9:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(delphinus) pinnae aculeos velut vagina condens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 8, § 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 15, 17, § 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:174" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 52, 53, § 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:198" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 77, § 198</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus consultum inclusum in tabulis tamquam in vaginā reconditum habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut gladius ... ita vox in vaginā silentii condita hebetatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 3, p. 357, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50098.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sheath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">holder</hi> of any thing. </sense><sense id="n50098.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia principalia viscera membranis propriis ac velut vaginis inclusit natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 77, § 198</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cremato eo (corpore), inimici ... remeanti animae veluti vaginam ademerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 52, 53, § 174</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50098.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The sheath</hi> of an ear of grain, etc., <hi rend="ital">the hull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">husk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:48:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 48, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 51</bibl>.—Cf. of a frame or mould to shape a growing gourd, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 24, § 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50098.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The female vagina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 85</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50098.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The sheath of a claw</hi>, in cats, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 15, 17, § 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vaginula: <entryFree id="n50099" type="hapax" key="va_gi_nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vāgīnŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>vagina, II.</etym>, <sense id="n50099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little sheath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">husk</hi> of ears of grain, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vagio: <entryFree id="n50100" type="main" key="va_gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vāgĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>root vāk-, vāg-; cf. Ved. vacati, roars; Lat. vacca, 2. vagor: idcirco vagire dicitur, exprimente verbo sonum vocis recentis, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:17:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 17, 2</bibl></etym>; of young children, <sense id="n50100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squall.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50100.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">audivisse vocem pueri visu'st vagientis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repuerascere et in cunis vagire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 23, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videtis ... populum non ut in cunabulis vagientem, sed adultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:11:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 11, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:405" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 405</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 208</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:8:35 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 8, 35 al.</bibl>—Of young goats, <cb n="VAGU" /> acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=104" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 104</bibl> Müll.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vagitus.—Of young hares, Auct. Carm. Philom. 60.—Of swine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:37" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 37</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n50100.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to sound</hi>: clamor ad caelum volvendu' per aethera vagit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=104" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 104</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 520 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
vagitus: <entryFree id="n50101" type="main" key="va_gi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vāgītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vagio</etym>, <sense id="n50101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a crying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squalling</hi> of young children: <cit><quote lang="la">vagitus et ploratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">2: vagituque locum lugubri complet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuo auditae voces vagitus et ingens Infantumque animae flentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 426</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edere vagitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonare vagitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:21:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 21, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">bleating</hi> of young goats, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:466" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 466</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=104" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 104</bibl> Müll.—Of a <hi rend="ital">crying</hi> for pain: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nox ulla ... Quae non audierit mixtos vagitibus aegris Ploratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:579" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 579</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7 praef.</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vago: <entryFree id="n50102" type="main" key="va^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văgo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n50102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form of vagor (ante-class.), <hi rend="ital">to wander</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te adloquor ... quae circum vicinos vagas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit> Brix: exsul incerta vagat, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 467, 25</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 225 Rib.): vagant matronae percitatae insaniā, Att. ap. Non. ib. (Trag. Rel. v. 236 ib.); cf. Varr., Turp., and Pompon. ib.</sense></entryFree>
vagor: <entryFree id="n50103" type="main" key="va^gor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văgor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n50103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [vagus], <hi rend="ital">to stroll about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go to and fro</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ramble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">range</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rove</hi> (class.; syn.: erro, palor). </sense><sense id="n50103.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">enim metuo ut possim reicere (boves) in bubile, ne vagentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (natura) efficiat volucres huc illuc passim vagantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:38:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 38, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in agris homines passim bestiarum more vagabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota Asia vagatur, volitat ut rex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volitabit et vagabitur in foro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 39, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toto foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 40, 184</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 15, 33</bibl> (11, 23): <cit><quote lang="la">totā urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibicines feriati vagantur per urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 17</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Germani latius jam vagabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libera vagandi facultas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:32" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui populabundi in finibus Romanorum vagabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:60:2" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 60, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quattuor milia hominum frumentatum egressa cum in agris passim vagarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:39:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 39, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58:11" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 58, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:545" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 545</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 9, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes circum tecta vagantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:540" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 540</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 560</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circum vicos ludibundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra Terminum curis vagor expeditis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 11</bibl></cit>.—Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">luna isdem spatiis vagatur quibus Sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:40:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 40, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae sponte suā, jussaene vagentur et errent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 17</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae quae errantes et quasi vagae nominantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 22</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">late vagatus est ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 42, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 29, 6</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n50103.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ino etiam primā terras aetate vagata est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>wandered through the earth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 28</bibl></cit> (3, 24), 19 (al. fugata est).—</sense><sense id="n50103.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to wander about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be unsettled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diffuse itself</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">speremus nostrum nomen volitare et vagari latissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam cum manent corpore, animo tamen excurrunt et vagantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum vagetur animus errore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne vagari et errare cogatur oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:48:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 48, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo fit, ut errem et vager latius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 20, 66</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 40</bibl> 88: <cit><quote lang="la">verba ita soluta, ut vagentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:44:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 44, 176</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:6:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 6, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">idcircone vager scribamque licenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non vagans oratio, sed defixa in unā re publicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:11:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 11, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">video, qui de agri culturā scripserunt ... latius vagatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Viennensium vitia inter ipsos residunt, nostra late vagantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 22, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea fama vagatur,</quote> <trans><tr>is spread abroad</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare mors immatura vagatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagantibus Graeciae fabulis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>variously related</tr>, <tr>fluctuating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50104" type="main" key="va_gor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vāgor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vagio</etym>, <sense id="n50104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagorem pro vagitu, Enn. (16, 32): qui clamos oppugnantis vagore volanti, Lucr. (2, 577),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=375" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 375</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 184, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vagulatio: <entryFree id="n50105" type="main" key="va_gu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vāgŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. obvagulo.</entryFree>
vagulus: <entryFree id="n50106" type="hapax" key="va^gu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văgŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n50106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [vagus], <hi rend="ital">wandering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roving</hi>: animula vagula, i. e. <hi rend="ital">hastening away</hi>, Hadrian. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vagus: <entryFree id="n50107" type="main" key="va^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">văgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root vagh-; Sanscr. vāhas; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)/xos</foreign>, wagon; cf. veho</etym>, <sense id="n50107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">strolling about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rambling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roaming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wandering</hi>,<pb n="1953" /> <cb n="VALE" />  <hi rend="ital">unfixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsettled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vagrant</hi> (freq. and class.; syn. errabundus). </sense><sense id="n50107.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vagus et exsul erraret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:62:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 62, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque vagus esse cogitabam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum existimabam vagos nos fore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gaetuli vagi, palantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo dispersa atque vaga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:25:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 25, 40</bibl></cit> (from <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 138:10" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 138, 10</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">quae circum vicinos vaga es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:39" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hercules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scurra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibicen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 27, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagi per silvas ritu ferarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:81" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 81</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: saepe vagos extra limina ferte pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 418</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refringit virgulta pede vago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne bestiae quidem ... facile patiuntur sese contineri motusque solutos et vagos a naturā sibi tributos requirunt,</quote> <trans><tr>unrestrained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:20:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 20, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrinationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 2:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">errores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 502</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:57:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 57, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of inanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (sidera) autem vaga et mutabili erratione labuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (stellae) errantes et quasi vagae nominarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aurorā exoriente vagi sub limina Solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 29, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:596" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 596</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 673</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena,</quote> <trans><tr>flying</tr>, <tr>light</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus (Scytharum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 24, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:63" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febres,</quote> <trans><tr>sporadic</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fel toto corpore,</quote> <trans><tr>diffusing itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 75, § 193</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50107.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">wandering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wavering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsteady</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconstant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doubtful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vague</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(in oratione) solutum quiddam sit nec vagum tamen,</quote> <trans><tr>capricious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 23, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus orationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 31, 119</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pars quaestionum vaga et libera et late patens,</quote> <trans><tr>indefinite</tr>, <tr>vague</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:16:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 16, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen Ambrosiae et circa alias herbas fluctuatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 4, 11, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de dis immortalibus habere non errantem et vagam, sed stabilem certamque sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaga volubilisque fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:26:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 26, 69</bibl></cit>: vaga popularisque supplicatio, <hi rend="ital">irregular</hi>, i. e. celebrated as men chanced to meet, without legal appointment, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:63:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 63, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incertum diu et quasi vagum imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagus adhuc Domitius,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>vacillating between the parties</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:76:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 76, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellae,</quote> <trans><tr>inconstant in love</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:5:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagae moderator juventae,</quote> <trans><tr>flighty</tr>, <tr>giddy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:90:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 90, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:6:2" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concubitu prohibere vago,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>promiscuous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 398</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:21:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 21, 6</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagus animi,</quote> <trans><tr>wandering in mind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 4</bibl></cit>.—<pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">văgē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">here and there</hi>, <hi rend="ital">far and wide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispersedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vage effusi per agros palatique, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:39:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 39, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res sparsae et vage disjectae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispergere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 31, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:48:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 48, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vah: <entryFree id="n50108" type="main" key="vah"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vah</orth> (fuller form <orth extent="full" lang="la">vaha</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 25</bibl>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 187</bibl> P.), <pos>interj.</pos>, = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ou)a/, ou)a=</foreign>; an exclamation of astonishment, joy, anger, etc., <sense id="n50108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ah! oh!</hi> vah! solus hic homo'st, qui sciat divinitus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 13</bibl> (ante-class. and late Lat.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vah! Homo amicus nobis jam inde a puero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vah consilium callidum!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum dolentes dicimus heu! vel cum delectamur vah dicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tract. in Joan. 51" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Tract. in Joan. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vah! apage te a me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vah! perii! hoc malum integrascit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 39, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:27:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 27, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vaha: <entryFree id="n50109" type="main" key="vaha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vaha</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, v. vah <sense id="n50109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vahalis: <entryFree id="n50110" type="main" key="Va^ha^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Văhălis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Waal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the left arm of the Rhine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 6</bibl>; Eum. Pan. ap. Constant. 8; <cit><quote lang="la">Pacat. Pan. ap. Theod, 5.—The same with the Vacalus, q. v.: ne conspectum quidem hostis sustinere valuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:7" default="NO">7, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:25" default="NO">9, 6, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:46:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 46, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:4:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 25, 4, 2</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Văchălis</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 12, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">23, 244</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
valdasus: <entryFree id="n50111" type="main" key="Valda^sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Valdăsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Pannonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 25, 28, § 148</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
valde: <entryFree id="n50112" type="main" key="valde_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">valdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. validus <sense id="n50112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
vale: <entryFree id="n50113" type="main" key="va^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vălē</orth>, v. valeo, I. B. 2. b.</entryFree>
valedico: <entryFree id="n50114" type="main" key="va^le^di_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vălĕ-dīco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n50114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n.;</hi> more freq. separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">vălĕ dĭco</orth>, v. valeo, I. B. d. <foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>. <cb n="VALE" /></sense></entryFree>
valens: <entryFree id="n50115" type="main" key="Va^lens1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vălens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the father of the third Mercury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50115.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman emperor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother and colleague of Valentinian</hi>, Cod. Th. 11, 28, 9.—</sense><sense id="n50115.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A nobleman of Cremona</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n50116" type="main" key="va^lens2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vălens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of valeo.</entryFree>
valenter: <entryFree id="n50117" type="main" key="va^lenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vălenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. valeo, <sense id="n50117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
valentia: <entryFree id="n50118" type="main" key="va^lenti^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vălentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>valens, from valeo</etym>, <sense id="n50118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bodily strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigor</hi> (ante- and post-class.): sapientia gubernator navem torquet, non valentia, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 186, 25</bibl>; Naev. ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 14 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50118.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Capacity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endowment</hi>: ultra communem hominum valentiam perspicaces, Boëth. Cons. Phil. 1.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50119" type="main" key="Va^lenti^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vălentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several towns.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50119.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of the Editani</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, now <hi rend="ital">Valencia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:18 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 18 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50119.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, now <hi rend="ital">Valence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 36</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n50119.3" n="III" level="1"> Vibo Valentia (called also simply Vibo or Vibon), <hi rend="ital">a town in the territory of the Bruttii</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Monteleone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>.— Hence. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vălentīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Valentia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:16:section=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 16, § 40</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n50119.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A name given to the southern part of Scotland</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in honor of the emperor Valentinian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 3, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50119.5" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A translation</hi> of Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*(rw/mh</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an ancient name of Rome</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
valentiniani: <entryFree id="n50120" type="main" key="Va^lenti_ni^a_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vălentīnĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sect of heretics in the second century</hi>, <hi rend="ital">against whom Tertullian wrote a book.</hi> They were named from Valentius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 30, 10</bibl>; Cod. Th. 10, 5, 65,§ 2.</sense></entryFree>
valentulus: <entryFree id="n50121" type="hapax" key="va^lentu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vălentŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n50121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [valens, from valeo], <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stout</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut valentual est!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
valeo: <entryFree id="n50122" type="main" key="va^le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vălĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>kindr. with Sanscr. bála, vis, robur, balishtas, fortissimus; cf. debilis</etym>, <sense id="n50122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be strong.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50122.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of physical strength, vigor, or health. </sense><sense id="n50122.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to be strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stout</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have strength</hi> (cf.: polleo, vigeo). </sense><sense id="n50122.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: verum illi valent, qui vi luctantur cum leonibus, Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 112, 4</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 176 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">puer ille (Hercules recens natus) ut magnus est et multum valet!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 51</bibl></cit>: plus potest, qui plus valet: Vir erat; <cit><quote lang="la">plus valebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:38 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 38 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanus homo, qui bene valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si magis valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si satis valet (= si satis validae vires sunt, just before),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 7 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prout nervi valent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 16</bibl></cit>.—Of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem novellam resecari tum erit tempus ubi valebit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 33, 3 sq.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n50122.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be strong</hi> in or for something, <hi rend="ital">to have the power</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be in condition</hi> to do something, etc. </sense><sense id="n50122.5" n="a" level="4"> Of personal subjects, etc. </sense><sense id="n50122.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alios videmus velocitate ad cursum, alios viribus ad luctandum valere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 107</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50122.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manibus pedibusque morbo distortissimis, ut neque calceum perpeti nec libellos evolvere valeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mustela cum mures veloces non valeret assequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valet ima summis Mutare deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. II.
