B. 2. h. infra; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illud mirari mitte, quod non valet e lapide hoc alias impellere res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1057" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1057</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versate diu quid ferre recusent, Quid valeant umeri (sc. ferre),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec valuere manus infixum educere telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 393</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:25" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50122.8" n="b" level="4"> Of remedies or medicines, <hi rend="ital">to be efficacious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be good for</hi> any thing; with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fimum potum ad dysentericos valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 105</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cimices valent contra serpentium morsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 17, § 61</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">eodem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quoque collyrium eodem valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 21</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">pro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruta per se pro antidoto valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 132</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictamnus valet potu et illitu et suffitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 15, 90, § 153</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sandaracha valet purgare, sistere, excalfacere, perrodere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 18, 55, § 177</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50122.9" n="c" level="4"> Of sounds: cum <hi rend="ital">C</hi> ac similiter <hi rend="ital">G</hi> non valuerunt, in <hi rend="ital">T</hi> ac <hi rend="ital">D</hi> molliuntur, i. e. <hi rend="ital">were not pronounced strongly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50122.10" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in respect of the natural condition of the body, <hi rend="ital">to be well</hi> in health, <hi rend="ital">to be in a sound</hi> or <hi rend="ital">healthy condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be healthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hearty.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50122.11" n="a" level="4"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n50122.12" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem valeo recte et salvus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetuon' valuisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">valen'? Valuistin? valeo et valui rectius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:12 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 12 sq.</bibl></cit>: facile omnes, quom valemus, <cb n="VALE" /> recta consilia aegrotis damus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicit vilicus servos non valuisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 3 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves ut recte valeant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optime valere et gravissime aegrotare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 25, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura est, ut valeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego valeo recte et rem gero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te recte valere operamque dare, ut cottidie melius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: deterius quam soleo, Luccei. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commode,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 20, 11</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ni.</hi> Benene usque valuit? <hi rend="ital">Chr.</hi> Pancratice atque athletice, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus valere ... melius valere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam matri oculi si valerent, mecum venisset simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50122.13" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">si corpore valuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:20:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 20, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec melius valeo quam corpore, mente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:8:33" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 8, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 11, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomacho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:100" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50122.14" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:30:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 30, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a morbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; and facetiously: <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Ain tu te valere? <hi rend="ital">Eu.</hi> Pol ego haud a pecuniā perbene, <hi rend="ital">as to money</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not very well</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50122.15" n="b" level="4"> Esp., at the commencement of letters (very freq.), si vales, bene est, and abbreviated S. V. B. E.; <cit><quote lang="la">and, more fully, with the addition ego or equidem valeo (abbrev. E. V. or E. Q. V.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 16</bibl>; 14, 17; 14, 21; 14, 22; 14, 23; 14, 24; 15, 1; 15, 2; Metell. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 1</bibl>; Vatin. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 9</bibl>; Luccei. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 14 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mos antiquis fuit usque ad meam servatus aetatem, primis epistulae verbis adicere: Si vales bene est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 15:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 15, 1</bibl></cit>; so too: S. V. G. V. (si vales, gaudeo, valeo) et Tullia nostra recte V. Terentia minus belle habuit: sed certum scio jam convaluisse eam, Dolab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 9, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n50122.16" n="c" level="4"> Rarely <hi rend="ital">impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid agitur, Sagaristio? ut valetur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50122.17" n="d" level="4"> Vale or valeas, in leave-taking, <hi rend="ital">farewell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adieu</hi> (cf.: salve, ave). </sense><sense id="n50122.18" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen.: <hi rend="ital">Di.</hi> Valeas. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Vale, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 79</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ar.</hi> Vale. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Quo properas? <hi rend="ital">Ar.</hi> Bene vale, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene vale, Alcumena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vale atque salve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 36</bibl>: vale atque salve. <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Male vale, male sit tibi, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 32</bibl>; v. salvus: <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Ad portum propero. <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Bene ambulato. <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Bene valeto. <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Bene sit tibi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene valete et vivite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ite intro cito: valete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abeo: valete, judices justissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. prol. 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos valete et plaudite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc biduom vale,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vive valeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 110</bibl></cit>.—Before a vowel, scanned vălĕ: <cit><quote lang="la">et longum, Formose valē, valē, inquit Iolla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:501" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 501</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50122.19" n="(b)" level="5"> At the conclusion of letters: <cit><quote lang="la">Vale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 22, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 8, 2</bibl>; Luccei. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 14, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura ut valeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 20, 3</bibl>; rarely bene vale, Mat. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 11, 28, 8</bibl>; Cur. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 7, 29, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tu me diligis et valebis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ib. 9, 22, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 18, 2</bibl>: fac valeas meque mutuo diligas, Planc. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 10, 7, 2</bibl>; Mat. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 11, 28, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50122.20" n="(g)" level="5"> Also in bidding farewell to the dead: <cit><quote lang="la">salve aeternum mihi, maxime Palla, Aeternumque vale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:208" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 208</bibl>; cf. Varr. ap. Serv. Verg. l. l.; <cit><quote lang="la">v. salvus: in perpetuom, frater, ave atque vale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:101:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 101, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terque, Vale, dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:563" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 563</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supremumque vale ... dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50122.21" n="(d)" level="5"> As an expression of dismission, refusal, or scorn, <hi rend="ital">be off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">begone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">valeas, tibi habeas res tuas, reddas meas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immo habeat, valeat, vivat cum illā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valeas, habeas illam quae placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si talis est deus, ut nullā hominum caritate teneatur, valeat,</quote> <trans><tr>good-by to him</tr>, <tr>let me have nothing to do with him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:44:124" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 44, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valeat res ludicra, si me Palma negata macrum, donata reducit opimum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 180</bibl></cit>: valeant, Qui inter nos discidium volunt, <hi rend="ital">away with those</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare ista valeant: me res familiaris movet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 15, 5</bibl></cit>: castra peto, valeatque Venus, valeantque puellae, <hi rend="ital">farewell to Venus</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:9" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">valete curae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 79</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 8, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 6, 71</bibl> sqq.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With valere jubere or dicere (sometimes as one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">vălĕdīco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>), <hi rend="ital">to bid one good-by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">farewell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adieu</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum salutavi: post etiam jussi valere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix illud potui dicere triste vale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe vale dicto rursus sum multa locutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi valedicere non licet gratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 17:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 17, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 1, 3, 1</bibl>: obstinatissime<pb n="1954" /> <cb n="VALE" />  retinuit, ut liberti servique bis die frequentes adessent ac mane salvere, vesperi valere sibi singuli dicerent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 72</bibl>.—So (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">vale facere (or valefacere),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Ep. 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 150, 24</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n50122.22" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to have power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">influence; to be powerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effective</hi>, <hi rend="ital">valid; to avail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effective</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n50122.23" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">fiet enim quodcunque volent, qui valebunt: valebunt autem semper arma,</quote> <trans><tr>will always have the power</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit enim populi potestas: de civitate ne tam diu quidem valuit quam diu illa Sullani temporis arma valuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:30:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 30, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicitur C. Flaminius ad populum valuisse dicendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 14, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunus plebis tulit ... ut lex Aelia et Fufia ne valeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in more majorum, qui tum ut lex valebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:10:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valuit auctoritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 22, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba si valent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 21, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ejus) valet opinio tarditatis,</quote> <trans><tr>is established</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:27:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 27, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si conjuratio valuisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus ratio non valuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus tamen gentium valuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor ... ratus repentinum valiturum terrorem, succedit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 31, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et vestrae valuere preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 3, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:241" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 241</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50122.24" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n50122.25" n="1" level="3"> With respect to the source, character, or mode of exercise of the strength ascribed to the subject. </sense><sense id="n50122.26" n="a" level="4"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">non metuo mihi ... Dum quidem hoc valebit pectus perfidiā meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqui duo sic exaequantur, ut Domitius valeat amicis, Memmius commendetur militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 6</bibl></cit> (17, 2): <cit><quote lang="la">multa sanxit quae omnia magistratuum auctoritate et Halaesinorum summā voluntate valuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:49:section=122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 49, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita istam libertatem largior populo, ut auctoritate et valeant et utantur boni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:17:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 17, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (voluntas militum) cum per se valet multitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:18:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 18, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum valent (Graeci) verbo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>have no precise word</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui aut gratiā aut misericordiā valerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui pedum cursu valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Battiades ... Quamvis ingenio non valet, arte valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 15, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerique plus ingenio quam arte valuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtilitate vincimur, valeamus pondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50122.27" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sp. Thorius satis valuit in populari genere dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:36:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 36, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid facilius est quam probari in uno servulo nomen familiae non valere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:19:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 19, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his maxime valet similitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mire in causis valet praesumptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(digitus) in exprobrando et indicando valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50122.28" n="2" level="3"> With some definite end expressed, upon or towards which influence or power is exercised or directed, <hi rend="ital">to be strong enough for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adequate to</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">capable of</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to be able</hi> to do, <hi rend="ital">to have force</hi> or <hi rend="ital">efficacy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be effectual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to avail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be applicable.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50122.29" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc evenit, ut in volgus insipientium opinio valeat honestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaecumque est hominis definitio, una in omnes valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:10:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 10, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:56:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 56, 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illud verbum unde in utramque rem valeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:31:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 31, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num etiam in deos inmortales inauspicatam legem valuisse? Liv 7, 6, 11: utrumque hoc genus semel injectum in L. annos valet et frugum et pabuli ubertate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 7, 4, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiamsi in utramque partem valent arma facundiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc etiam in praeteritum valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ... idque in omnis partis valeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50122.30" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">eo</hi>: oratio me cohortabatur, ut, etc. ... quod eo, credo, valebat, ut caerimonias religionesque defenderem, <hi rend="ital">the force</hi> or <hi rend="ital">point of which was</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id responsum quo valeat, cum intellegeret nemo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. II. B. 3. <foreign lang="greek">i</foreign>, infra.—</sense><sense id="n50122.31" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <case>acc.</case> of thing: <cit><quote lang="la">tu non solum ad neglegendas leges ... verum etiam ad evertendas valuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: astrorum affectio valeat, si vis, ad quasdam res; <cit><quote lang="la">ad omnis certe non valebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:4:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud perficiam ut invidia mihi valeat ad gloriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae adjuncta esse dicebant, quae ad virtutis usum valerent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista quaestura ad eam rem valet, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:19:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 19, 62</bibl></cit>: neque, quod Samnites ... amici vobis facti <cb n="VALE" /> sunt, ad id valere arbitror, ne nos in amicitiam accipiamur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 30, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem fictio valet et ad qualitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:99" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 99</bibl></cit>; cf. II. B. 3. infra.—</sense><sense id="n50122.32" n="d" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">apud</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc. of person</hi> influenced, etc. </sense><sense id="n50122.33" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">apud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibit ad illud ilico, Quo maxume apud te se valere sentiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quin eam (commendationem) valituram apud te arbitrarer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud te veritas valebit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed haec eadem nunc censes apud eos ipsos valere, a quibus ... conscripta sunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnis meritis apud regem ... valebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus bonumque apud eos non legibus magis quam naturā valebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud magnam partem senatūs et magnitudine rerum gestarum valebat et gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:48:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 48, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud nos valeant ea, quae apud judices valere volumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50122.34" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicitur enim C. Flaminius ... ad populum valuisse dicendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 14, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clementiae fama ... ad ferociores jam populos valuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metus ad omnis valuit, ne deditionem recusarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 28, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50122.35" n="e" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">contra</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc nonne videtur contra te valere?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 27, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae valeant contra falsam criminationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:79:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 79, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid esset ... quod contra caput suum aut existimationem valere posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:71:section=173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 71, § 173</bibl></cit>: ne meae vitae modestia parum valitura sit contra falsos rumores, Mat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 28, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pro falsis contra veritatem (rhetorice) valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. f. infra.—</sense><sense id="n50122.36" n="f" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">pro</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa in adversos effudit verba penates Pro deplorato non valitura viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:46" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epitheton valet pro nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. I. A. 2, b. supra.—</sense><sense id="n50122.37" n="g" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">dat. gerund.</hi> (post-class. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nam et augendae rei et minuendae valet (particula),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:12:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 12, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50122.38" n="h" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.): nam si certam finem esse viderent Aerumnarum homines, aliquā ratione valerent Religionibus ... obsistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc ob rem vitam retinere valemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec continere suos ab direptione castrorum valuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 23, 4</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (urbem) neque finitimi valuerunt perdere Marsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:3" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera ... adeo sunt multa, loquacem Delassare valent Fabium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 7, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec valuit locos coeptos avertere cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:55" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui relicti erant ... ne conspectum quidem hostis sustinere valuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ex eo infamiam discutere valuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 79</bibl></cit>.—With things as subj.: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo fungar vice cotis, acutum Reddere quae ferrum valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 305</bibl></cit>; cf. I. A. 2. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>, supra.—Esp., </sense><sense id="n50122.39" n="3" level="3"> With adverbial qualifications expressing the degree of power or influence exerted, etc.; very freq. with <hi rend="ital">accs-</hi> multum, plus, plurimum, parum, minus, minimum, nihil, tantum, quantum, quid, id, idem, quiddam, quidquam, quidquid, etc. </sense><sense id="n50122.40" n="(a)" level="5"> Edepol, Cupido, cum tu tam pusillu's, nimis multum vales, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 421, 25</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 55 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">plus potest qui plus valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ita inperita (sum), ut quid amor valeat nesciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 42</bibl></cit>.—So <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: nam opulenti cum locuntur pariter atque ignobiles, Eadem dicta eademque oratio aequa non aeque valet, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 4, 3</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 230 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ignari quid gravitas ... quid denique virtus valeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:28:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 28, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa obnuntiatio nihil valuit, aut, si valuit, id valuit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:16:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 16, 30</bibl></cit>: omnia veniebant Antonio in mentem; <cit><quote lang="la">eaque suo quaeque loco, ubi plurimum proficere et valere possent ... collocabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:37:139" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 37, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur minus Venena Medaeae valent?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5</bibl></cit>. 62.—</sense><sense id="n50122.41" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tibi lubet fac, quoniam pugnis plus vales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 240</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">v. 234: quicquid possunt, pedestribus valent copiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui plus opibus, armis, potentiā valent, perfecisse mihi videntur ... ut etiam auctoritate jam plus valerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi vero ego ... in isto genere omnino quidquam aut curatione aut potestate valuissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ti. Coruncanium longe plurimum ingenio valuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 14, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum gratiā, auctoritate, pecuniā valerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar multum equitatu valebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tantum equitatu valeamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatu plurimum valere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 8, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50122.42" n="(g)" level="5"> <cb n="VALE" /> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil putas valere in judiciis conjecturam, nihil suspitionem, nihil ante actae vitae existimationem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:62:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 62, § 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic multum in Fabiā (tribu) valet, ille Velinā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 52</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50122.43" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum valuisse ad patris honorem pietas filii videbitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo intellegitur, plus terrarum situs, quam lunae tractus, ad nascendum valere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:46:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 46, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valet igitur multum ad vincendum probari mores eorum, qui agent causas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:43:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 43, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad subeundem periculum et ad vitandum multum fortuna valuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus ad probandam speciem minimum valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 56</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">apud</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc. of pers.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have influence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be influential</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have weight with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">influence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud quem (Caesarem) quicquid valebo vel auctoritate, vel gratiā, valebo tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum apud eos pudor atque officium, an timor plus valeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum apud homines barbaros valuit, esse repertos aliquos principes belli inferendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestis constituere, hanc auctoritatem quantum apud exteras nationes valituram esse existimetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo praemiis, quae apud me minimum valent, sed ne periculis quidem conpulsus ullis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus esse indignum, plus impudicissimae mulieris apud te de Cleomenis salute quam de suā vitā lacrimas matris valere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:43:section=112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 43, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud quem ut multum gratiā valeret, effecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>: cur desperemus veritatem contra fallacem facundiam valituram? <hi rend="ital">prevail</hi>, Lact. Opif. Dei, 20, 5; cf. Mat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 28, 8</bibl>, II. B. 2, e. supra.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">pro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro periculo magis quam contra salutem valere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:35:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 35, 120</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod minus multitudine militum legionariorum pro hostium numero valebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 51</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimum inter eos Bellovacos et virtute, et auctoritate, et hominum numero valere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">i</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">adv. of pur pose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc eo valebat, ut ingratiis ad de pugnandum omnes cogerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tamen hoc eo valet, ut fugien dae sint magnae scholae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescis quo valeat nummus, quem praebeat usum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 73</bibl></cit>; cf. II. B. 2. b. supra. —</sense><sense id="n50122.44" n="C" level="2"> Idiomatic uses. </sense><sense id="n50122.45" n="1" level="3"> Of money value, <hi rend="ital">to be of the value of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be worth</hi>: denarii, quod denos aeris valebant; <cit><quote lang="la">quinarii, quod quinos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=173" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 173</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">dum pro argenteis decem aureus unus valeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ut scrupulum valeret sestertiis vicenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si haec praedia valeant nunc decem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:7:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 1, 7, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi minimo valeret hereditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:13" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanti omnibus valet (servus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:33" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 9, 2, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:3:25:section=1" default="NO">5, 3, 25, § 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50122.46" n="2" level="3"> Of the signification of words, sentences, etc.; like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">du/nasqai</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">import</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerimus verbum Latinum par Graeco et quod idem valeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: non usquam id quidem dicit omnino; <cit><quote lang="la">sed quae dicit, idem valent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:10:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam vocabula prope idem valere videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:8:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc verbum quid valeat, non vident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 9, 39</bibl></cit>: cui nomen Becco fuerat; <cit><quote lang="la">id valet gallinacei rostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pransus quoque atque potus diversum valent quam indicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 29</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">et intellego et sentio et video saepe idem valent quod scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo quae idem significant ac tantumdem valent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">vălens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n50122.47" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50122.48" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: nil moro discipulos mihi esse plenos sanguinis; <cit><quote lang="la">valens adflictet me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robusti et valentes et audaces satellites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 31, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum homo imbecillus a valentissimā bestiā laniatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valentissimi lictores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:54:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 54, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 10, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic membris et mole valens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 431</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membris valens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpore esse vegeto et valenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:1:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervi musculique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trunci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 426</bibl></cit>: scire oportet, omnia legumina generis valentissimi esse: valentissimum voco, in quo plurimum alimenti est ... Ex leguminibus valentior faba quam pisum, etc., <hi rend="ital">strongest</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">most nutritire</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicae,</quote> <trans><tr>stout</tr>, <tr>thick</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 109</bibl></cit>: providendum ne infirmiores (apes) a valentioribus<pb n="1955" /> <cb n="VALE" />  opprimantur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:35" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50122.49" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n50122.50" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Well</hi> in health, <hi rend="ital">healthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hearty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">valeo et venio ad minus valentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicus plane confirmat, propediem te valentem fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer, horā undecimā cum valens in publico visus esset, ante noctem mortuus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 9, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">valens (opp. imbecillus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sensus) si sani sunt et valentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si valens corpus est neque magno opere vexatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 26, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive aegra, sive valens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 21</bibl></cit> (3, 14), 20.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui enim aegris subveniretur, quae esset oblectatio valentium, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. aeger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:44:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 44, 186</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50122.51" n="b" level="4"> Of medicines, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">active</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">valens est adversus cancerem intestinorum minii gleba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvestri (papaveri capita) ad omnes effectus valentiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 18, 76, § 202</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 22, 43, § 87</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50122.52" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mighty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mallem tantas ei (Caesari) vires non dedisset (res publica) quam nunc tam valenti resisteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit quondam ita firma haec civitas et valens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:28:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 28, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum valentiore pugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valens dialecticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:6:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fieri nihil possit valentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 16, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philippus jam tum valens multa moliebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opibus jam valentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eum. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumenta valentiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid pars adversa habeat valentissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec fraus valentior quam consilium meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad letum causae satis valentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 174</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:8:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 8, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa valentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:10:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus morbo omni valentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:111" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida valentissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ham. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vă-lenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">strongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stoutly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violently</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n50122.53" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">resistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:15" default="NO">3, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis valenter ibi retenta materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceps spirare valentius Eurus (coepit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 481</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50122.54" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">forcibly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">energetically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non diu dicebat sed valenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 22 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si verba numeres, breviter et abscise: si sensum aestimes, copiose et valenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 7</bibl></cit>, ext. 6.</sense></entryFree>
valeria: <entryFree id="n50123" type="main" key="va^le^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vălĕrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of eagle</hi>, called by the Greeks melanaĕtos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
valerianus: <entryFree id="n50124" type="main" key="Va^le^ri^a_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vălĕrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Valerius.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50125" type="main" key="Va^le^ri^a_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vălĕrĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; Licinius, <sense id="n50125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman emperor</hi>, A. D. 253-260, <hi rend="ital">father of the emperor Gallienus</hi>, Treb. Val. 1 sqq.; <hi rend="ital">after him were named</hi> Valeriani aurei, Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
valerius: <entryFree id="n50126" type="main" key="Va^le^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vălĕrĭus</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vălĕsĭus</orth>, acc. to Fest. s. v. Aureliam, p. 23 Müll.; v. letter R), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vălĕrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n50126.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The favorite of the people</hi>, P. Valerius Publicola, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 31, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 23, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laevinum, Valerī genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50126.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The historian</hi>, Q. Valerius Antias, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:7:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 7, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50126.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The poets</hi> C. Valerius Flaccus and M. Valerius Martialis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 21</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n50126.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The writer of Memorabilia</hi>, Valerius Maximus, al.—As <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50126.5" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vălĕrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Valerius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 25</bibl>: lex, <hi rend="ital">of the</hi> interrex <hi rend="ital">L. Valerius Flaccus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:43:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 43, 125</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of the</hi> Consul suffectus, 668 A. U. C., <hi rend="ital">L. Valerius Flaccus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 1</bibl>: tabula, <hi rend="ital">a place in the forum beside the</hi> Curia Hostilia (so called from the tablet erected there in memory of M. Valerius Maximus Messala, consul 491 A. U. C., victorious in Gaul, Schol. Bob. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:page=318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. p. 318</bibl> Orell.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 9, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50126.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vălĕrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Valerius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Valerian</hi>: praedatores, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 553, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
valesco: <entryFree id="n50127" type="main" key="va^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vălesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n50127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [valeo], <hi rend="ital">to grow strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquire strength</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): (puerorum aetas) tali pacto recreata valescat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:942" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 942</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 17</bibl>: sucus ex quo omne corpus valescit, Ambros. de Noë et Arca, 9, 28.—</sense><sense id="n50127.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelera impetu, bona consilia mora valescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meditatio et labor in posterum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
valetudinarius: <entryFree id="n50128" type="main" key="va^le_tu_di^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vălētūdĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>valetudo</etym>, <sense id="n50128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infirm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">valetudinary</hi> <cb n="VALG" /> (not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n50128.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus (opp. sanum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fenerator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:33:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 33, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50128.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50128.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vălētūdĭnā-rĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one in infirm health</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an invalid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">valetudinarian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ebrioso vina mittere aut valetudinario medicamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:11:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 11, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:12:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 12, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:1:41" default="NO">27, 1, 41</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n50128.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vălētūdĭnārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n50128.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sick-room</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hospital</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infirmary</hi>, Cels. praef.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 27:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 27, 1</bibl>; id. Ira, 1, 16, 3; 2, 16, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 1</bibl>, praef. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:8" default="NO">12, 3, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50128.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A military lazar - house</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hospital</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:6:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 6, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
valetudo: <entryFree id="n50129" type="main" key="va^le_tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vălētūdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vălītūdo</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>valeo</etym>, <sense id="n50129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">habit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">state</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">condition of body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">state of health</hi>, <hi rend="ital">health</hi>, whether good or bad. </sense><sense id="n50129.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50129.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">optimā valetudine uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudine minus commodā uti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 6, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">melior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 63, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commodior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incommoda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirma atque etiam aegra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:48:180" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 48, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam tenui aut nullā potius valetudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 11, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confirmata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:16:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 16, § 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:62:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 62, 265</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut valetudini tuae diligentissime servias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:16:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 16, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum interest inter vires et bonam valetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1</bibl></cit>, praef. 6.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: sic caecitas ferri facile possit, si non desint subsidia valetudinum, <hi rend="ital">of different states of health</hi>, i. e. whatever they may be, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 113</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50129.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n50129.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A good state</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soundness of body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good health</hi>, <hi rend="ital">healthfulness</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">salus, sanitas): valetudo decrescit, adcrescit labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudo (opportuna est), ut dolore careas et muneribus fungare corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui Gratia, fama, valetudo contingat abunde,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudo sustentatur notitiā sui corporis et observatione, quae res aut prodesse soleant aut obesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:24:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 24, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melior fio valetudine, quam intermissis exercitationibus amiseram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id pecus valetudinis tutissimae est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc cibo ... firmitatem valetudinis custodiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 20, § 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Quaque valetudo constat, nunc libera morbis, Nunc oppressa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 3, 140</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:62:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 62, 265</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50129.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A bad state</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ill health</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sickness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feebleness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infirmity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indisposition</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmitas, imbecillitas): curatio valetudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 59, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravitas valetudinis, quā tamen jam paulum videor levari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectus valetudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravis auctumnus omnem exercitum valetudine tentaverat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodam valetudinis genere tentari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod me propter valetudinem tuam ... non vidisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod his Nonis in collegio nostro non affuisses, valetudinem causam, non maestitiam fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excusatione te uti valetudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (latere, voce) fractis aut imminutis aetate seu valetudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicus quid in quoque valetudinis genere faciendum sit, docebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Blaesus novissimā valetudine conflictabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">major, i. e. morbus comitialis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 27, 100, § 173</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicus regere valetudines principis solitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudinibus fessi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ad febrium valitudines attinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 24, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graves et periculosas valetudines experiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50129.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (rare but class.), of the mind, <hi rend="ital">health</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soundness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sanity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ii sunt constituti quasi malā valetudine animi, sanabiles tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:37:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 37, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">roga bonam mentem, bonam valetudinem animi, deinde tunc corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 10:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 10, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudo ei neque corporis neque animi constitit,</quote> <trans><tr>unsound state of mind</tr>, <tr>mental infirmity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 50</bibl></cit>.—Rarely without <hi rend="ital">animi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui valetudinis vitio furerent et melancholici dicerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:38:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 38, 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50129.7" n="B" level="2"> Of style: <cit><quote lang="la">quos (Lysiae studiosi), valetudo modo bona sit, tenuitas ipsa delectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 16, 64</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50129.8" n="III" level="1"> Personified: Valetudo, <hi rend="ital">Health</hi>, as a divinity, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
valgiter: <entryFree id="n50130" type="main" key="valgi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">valgĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. valgus <sense id="n50130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
valgius: <entryFree id="n50131" type="main" key="Valgi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Valgĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> <cb n="VALI" /> gens. </sense><sense id="n50131.1" n="1" level="3"> T. Valgius Rufus, <hi rend="ital">an epic poet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:180" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 180</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 82</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50131.2" n="2" level="3"> C. Valgius, <hi rend="ital">a rhetorician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:17" default="NO">3, 5, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50131.3" n="3" level="3"> Valgius, father-in-law of Rullus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
valgus: <entryFree id="n50132" type="main" key="valgus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">valgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root varg, to turn awry, twist; Sanscr. vrginas, twisted; cf. ruga, for fruga, and Anglo-Sax. wrinkle</etym>, <sense id="n50132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having the calves of the legs bent outwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bow-legged.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50132.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">valgos Opilius Aurelius aliique complures aiunt dici, qui diversas suras habeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=375" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 375</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 20</bibl>; Plaut. Fragm. ap. Fest. l. l.; Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 25, 12</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n50132.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavia,</quote> <trans><tr>wry mouths</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>.—Cf. <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">valgĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">awry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wryly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">valgiter commovebat labra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 26</bibl></cit>: obtorto valgiter labello, id. Fragm. ap. Fulg. Prisc. serm. 566, 2.</sense></entryFree>
valide: <entryFree id="n50133" type="main" key="va^li^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vălĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. validus <sense id="n50133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
