<bibl default="NO">2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 68</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:624 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 624 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 601</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n50326.11" n="e" level="4"> In a subordinate alternative after aut: <cit><quote lang="la">nec aut tibi ipsi aut huic Secundo vel huic Apro ignotas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne contra Gai quidem aut Claudii vel Neronis ... domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abscedens in hortos aut Tusculanum vel Antiatem in agrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dementiae quoque judicia aut propter id quod factum est aut propter id quod adhuc fieri vel non fieri potest instituuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.12" n="B" level="2"> As co-ordinate. </sense><sense id="n50326.13" n="1" level="3"> Vel ... vel, <hi rend="ital">either ... or</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be it ... or;</hi> in gen. (class.; but where the alternatives are necessary and exclusive, that is, where one must be right and the other wrong, aut ... aut is used; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, and cf. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:11:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 11, 27</bibl>): sed hic numquis adest? <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Vel adest vel non, i. e. <hi rend="ital">just as you please</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 28</bibl> Brix ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">paucis me misit ad eam ... vel ut ducentos Philippos reddat aureos, vel ut hinc eat secum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:1:18 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 1, 18 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi illic biberit, vel servato meum modum vel ego dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel tu me vende, vel face quod tibi lubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quamobrem huc sum missa, amabo, vel tu mihi ajas, vel neges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Allobrogibus sese vel persuasuros ... existimabant, vel vi coacturos, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (Romani) vel sibi agros attribuant vel patiantur eos tenere, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel sumptuosae vel desidiosae illecebrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni vel officio vel sermone sollers,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximum virtutis vel documentum, vel officium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pace vel Quirini vel Romuli dixerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 10, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erant quaestiones vel de caede vel de vi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:14:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 14, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:69:242" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 69, 242</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus vel bello vel paci paratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc ordinem ex censu descripsit vel paci decorum vel bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 42, 5</bibl></cit>: Etruriam et Samnium provincias esse; <cit><quote lang="la">utram mallet eligeret: suo exercitu se vel in Etruriā vel in Samnio rem gesturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 19, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladioque ruptis omnibus loris, oraculi sortem vel elusit vel implevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil illo fuisset excellentius vel in vitiis vel in virtutibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Milt. 3, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.14" n="b" level="4"> Connected with <hi rend="ital">aut</hi>, but not corresponding to it (cf. infra, 2. e.): <cit><quote lang="la">num aut tuum aut cujusquam nostrum nomen vel Caucasum hunc transcendere potuit vel illum Gangem transnatare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 20, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi enim potest illa aetas aut calescere vel apricatione melius vel igni aut vicissim umbris aquisve refrigerari salubrius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 16, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si velim scribere quid aut legere aut canere vel voce vel fidibus, aut geometricum quiddam aut physicum aut dialecticum explicare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 59, 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.15" n="2" level="3"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n50326.16" n="a" level="4"> With weakened disjunctive force (nearly = et ... et). quemadmodum ille vel Athenis vel Rhodi se doctissimorum hominum sermonibus dedisset, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos sine ratione, sine litteris, quā vel inpudentia vel fames duxit, ruentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectus vel illos mites vel hos concitatos in suā potestate habuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: eadem quaestio potest eundem vel accusatorem<cb n="VEL" />  facere vel reum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 18</bibl>: et nundina vetera ex ordine instituit, vel dies vel tempora, Lampr Alex. Sev. 43: pestilentia tanta exstiterat vel Romae, vel Achaicis urbibus, ut, etc., Treb. Gall. 5.—</sense><sense id="n50326.17" n="b" level="4"> More than twice, <hi rend="ital">either ... or ... or</hi>, etc. tu vel suda, vel peri algu, vel tu aegrota, vel vale, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hance tu mihi vel vi vel clam vel precario Fac tradas: meā nil re fert, dum potiar modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel in tempestate, vel in agris, vel in corporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 44, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel quod ita vivit vel quod ita rem publicam gerit vel quod ita factus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel spectator laudum tuarum vel particeps vel socius vel minister consiliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,018:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. Quir. 9, 23</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so eight times,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50326.18" n="c" level="4"> The second (or last) vel strengthened, </sense><sense id="n50326.19" n="(a)" level="5"> By etiam: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vel ad usum vitae vel etiam ad ipsam rem publicam conferre possumus,</quote> <trans><tr>or even</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:8:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 8, 30</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 29, 45</bibl>; 2, 1, 1; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vel ea defendam, quae Pompejus velit, vel taceam, vel etiam ad nostra me studia referam litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.20" n="(b)" level="5"> By vero etiam: <cit><quote lang="la">in mediocribus vel studiis vel officiis, vel vero etiam negotiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.21" n="(g)" level="5"> By omnino: haec vel ad odium, vel ad misericordiam, vel omnino ad animos judicum movendos ex iis quae sunt ante posita, sumentur (<hi rend="ital">or in general</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:36:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 36, 128</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.22" n="d" level="4"> Rarely after a negative = neque, <hi rend="ital">nor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque satis Bruto ... vel tribunis militum constabat, quid agerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.23" n="e" level="4"> In irregular construction, without the second vel: <cit><quote lang="la">utrumque est in his, quod ab hoc oratore abhorreat: vel quod omnis, qui sapientes non sint, insanos esse dicunt ... accedit quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:18:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 18, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 7, 5</bibl>; cf. esp. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 383</bibl> sqq. Munro ad loc. —</sense><sense id="n50326.24" n="f" level="4"> Vel ... vel = aut ... aut: <cit><quote lang="la">habere ea, quae secundum naturam sint, vel omnia vel plurima et maxima,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>so nearly all that the difference is unimportant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:11:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 11, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Madv. ad loc.: cum bonā quidem spe, ut ait idem, vel vincendi vel in libertate moriendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.—For vel ... vel, in a subordinate alternative after aut, v. the examples under I. B. 1. b. supra.—</sense><sense id="n50326.25" n="g" level="4"> Vel, correl. with <hi rend="ital">aut</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">verborum quoque vis ac proprietas confirmatur vel praesumptione ... aut reprehensione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces ... aut productione tantum vel correptione mutatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 69</bibl></cit> (but the line <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:546" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 546</bibl>, is spurious); so, <cit><quote lang="la">aut ... aut ... vel: ut aut de nomine aut scripto et sententiā vel ratiocinatione quaeratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut ... aut ... aut ... aut ... vel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:68 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 68 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi regnat Protogenes aliquis vel Diphilus aut Erimarchus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:120" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 120</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n50326.26" n="II" level="1"> As intens. particle (prop. ellipt., implying an alternative the first member of which is omitted, something else <hi rend="ital">or even</hi> this, etc.). </sense><sense id="n50326.27" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">or even</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if you will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">or indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">or ... itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">even</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuredly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certainly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50326.28" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum opsonium autem pol vel legioni sat est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita me di ament, vel in lautumiis, vel in pistrino mavelim Agere aetatem, Quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ep.</hi> Si arte poteris accubare. <hi rend="ital">Ge.</hi> Vel inter cuneos ferreos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel rex semper maxumas Mihi agebat gratias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tamen vel regnum malo quam liberum populum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:34:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 34, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">isto quidem modo vel consulatus vituperabilis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:10:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se vel principes ejus consilii fore profiterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel Priamo miseranda manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vel Prochytam praepono Suburae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile me paterer vel illo ipso acerrimo judice quaerente vel apud Cassianos judices ... pro Sex. Roscio dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:30:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 30, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus Romanus auctoritatem suam vel contra omnes defendere potest,</quote> <trans><tr>even if necessary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:22:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 22, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id se probaturum vel ipso Verginio judice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:44:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 44, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli necessitatibus eam patientiam non adhibebimus, quam vel lusus ac voluptas elicere solet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timebant ne Romana plebs ... vel cum servitute pacem acciperet,</quote> <trans><tr>even if it should involve their enslavement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.29" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">adjj.: Ch.</hi> Pax, te tribus verbis volo. <hi rend="ital">Sy.</hi> Vel trecentis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 122</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ca.</hi> Ut opperiare hos sex dies saltem modo ... <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Animo bono es. Vel sex mensis opperibor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 89</bibl>; cf.: jam hercle vel ducentae<pb n="1964" /> <cb n="VELA" />  minae, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 68</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 3, 111: hoc ascensu vel tres armati quamlibet multitudinem arcuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 24, 7</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Dane suavium? <hi rend="ital">Di.</hi> Immo vel decem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego illum eunuchum, si opus sit, vel sobrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si sit opus, vel totum triduom,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sunt omnia ingenii vel mediocris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:27:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 27, 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.30" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">verbs</hi>: namque edepol quamvis desubito vel cadus vorti potest, <hi rend="ital">may even be turned over</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">will be empty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ego hinc abiero, vel occidito,</quote> <trans><tr>if you will</tr>, <tr>even</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per me vel stertas licet, inquit Carneades, non modo quiescas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ipsis sententiis, quibus proluserunt, vel pugnare possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vel abundare debeam, cogor mutuari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15</bibl></cit> 15, 3—</sense><sense id="n50326.31" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">pronn.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">videndum erit, quid quisque vel sine nobis aut possit consequi aut non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">existiment quod velint, ac vel hoc intellegant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est tibi ex his ipsis qui assunt bella copia, vel ut a te ipso ordiare,</quote> <trans><tr>especially as you can begin with yourself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:40:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 40, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.32" n="B" level="2"> With superlatives, to denote the highest possible degree, <hi rend="ital">the very; the utmost; the most...possible.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50326.33" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>: hoc invenisset unum ad morbum illum homini vel bellissimum, <hi rend="ital">the very loveliest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the most beautiful possible</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 527, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidi in dolore podagrae ipsum vel omnium maximum Stoicorum Posidonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,062:ib. 32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fragm. ib. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc in genere nervorum vel minimum, suavitatis autem est vel plurimum,</quote> <trans><tr>the very least ... the utmost possible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:26:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 26, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum duarum (civitatum) si adessent (legationes), duo crimina vel maxima minuerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patre meā sententiā vel eloquentissimo temporibus illis,</quote> <trans><tr>the most eloquent possible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod erat ad obtinendam potentiam nobilium vel maximum, vehementer id retinebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:32:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 32, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (sc. Hannibalis) eo tempore vel maxima apud regem auctoritas erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 41, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vident unum senatorem vel tenuissimum esse damnatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fora templaque occupabantur, ut vel exspectatissimi triumphi laetitia praecipi posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:51" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed vel potentissima apud Amphictyonas aequi tractatio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:118" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:81" default="NO">11, 1, 81</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.34" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">With advv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel studiosissime quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Sophocles vel optime scripserit Electram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel maxime confirmare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:65:162" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 65, 162</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vel maxime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:4" default="NO">4, 3, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.35" n="C" level="2"> In adding an instance implying that other instances might be mentioned at will, <hi rend="ital">or</hi> this one; <hi rend="ital">for instance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for example</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as for example</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in particular</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Per pol quam paucos reperias Fideles amatores ... Vel hic Pamphilus jurabat quotiens Bacchidi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel heri in vino quam inmodestus fuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: nullast tam facilis res quin difficilis siet Quom invitus facias; <cit><quote lang="la">vel me haec deambulatio ... ad languorum dedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed suavis accipio litteras, vel quas proxime acceperam, quam prudentis!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus innumerabilia sunt exempla, vel Appii majoris illius, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:70:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 70, 284</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.36" n="D" level="2"> Concessive. </sense><sense id="n50326.37" n="1" level="3"> With superlatives, <hi rend="ital">perhaps</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens vel potentissimus nostrae civitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. A. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus vel optima Messanae, notissima quidem certe,</quote> <trans><tr>the best known</tr>, <tr>at any rate</tr>, <tr>if not the finest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:2:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.38" n="2" level="3"> = saltem, <hi rend="ital">at least</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā re etsi minus veram causam habebis, tamen vel probabilem aliquam poteris inducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimi semetipsos exhortantur vel aliquas partes earum (scientiarum) addiscere, quamvis universas percipere non possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac, ni flexisset animos, vel Aegypti praefecturam concedi sibi oraret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut messe vel unā releves colla perusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:12:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 12, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 8</bibl>; cf. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:16:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 16, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
